intro: Catabrosella humilis subsp. songorica, commonly known as the Songorica sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate habit and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in dry gardens and rockeries.
